description: The round payoff this round was 107. You, Kate chose to play option 2.John chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of 17.83.
Mutual defection (both choosing option 2) results in significantly lower individual payoffs compared to mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1)
The game structure creates a coordination problem with two Nash equilibria, where mutual defection is a risk-averse but suboptimal equilibrium
Asymmetric choices (one player choosing 2) penalize the cooperating player severely (0 payoff), incentivizing defensive play
